content: and #katziesbed on instagram round 1 *6sc work 2sc in 1 ch1 work 2sc in greetings from holland and thank 1 repeat from * to the end place a stitch marker you for supporting my work to mark the beginning of the round you can move it in every round or place new ones in warmly teti case you need to unravel to previous round round 2 22sc round 3 *7sc work 2sc in 1 4 times repeat from * to the end round 4 30sc round 5 *6sc work 2sc in 1 1sc 4 times work 2sc in 1 repeat from * to the end round 6 40sc round 7 *7sc work 2sc in 1 2sc 4 times work 2sc in 1 repeat from * to the end round 8 50sc round 9 8sc work 2sc in 1 3sc 4 times work 2sc in 1 repeat from * to the end fig 1 how to chain round 10 60sc round 11 11sc work 2sc in 1 2sc 6 times work 2sc in 1 repeat from * to the end round 12 74sc round 13 74sc this should be enough for a medium size cat or a small dog if you need a bigger size work more rounds and keep increasing evenly until reach the desired size cut the yarn on the pice that will be on the bottom and weave in the end joining before joining the halves weave in the ends on fig 2 how to work single_crochet the wrong side even though they will be hidden inside make sure they do not stick out later thank you amigurumi today website for the illustrations then put the 2 halves on top of each other with right side facing out page 2
